intro: Helosciadium australe, commonly known as the Australian marsh woundwort, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in wetland and swampy areas, thriving in moist, clay-rich soils. It features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. Helosciadium australe is often found in the eastern and southern regions of Australia, where it plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
